channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Two US 'mercenaries' are arrested after failed attempt 'to kill' Venezuela's President Maduro
item.description: Luke Denman, 34, and Airan Berry, 41, were arrested as part of an amateur attempt to overthrown President Nicolás Maduro that was foiled by Venezuelan authorities.

item.title: Nazi child concentration camp where prisoners were tortured to death is recreated in interactive map
item.description: Researchers from Poland's Institute of National Remembrance pieced together the layout of the Preventive Security Police Camp for Polish Youth in Lodz, where hundreds of children died.

item.title: Detectives quiz murder suspect, 42 after 79-year-old man is found dead with head injury
item.description: Anthony Rooks, 79, was discovered collapsed with a head injury at a property in Dalmeny Road, Holloway, north London at around 7.20pm on Monday. A 42-year-old man has been arrested.

item.title: A grandson's tribute: Filmmaker chronicles how his German Jewish grandfather escaped the Nazis
item.description: A new documentary called The Starfish takes a look at the life of Herb Gildin, who escaped Nazi Germany to settle in New York and become a successful businessman.

item.title: White House is looking to wind DOWN coronavirus taskforce
item.description: The coronavirus task force that has been meeting amid the outbreak will be 'winding down' in the coming weeks, according to a report.

item.title: Neil Ferguson whose advice led to lockdown QUITS after 'breaking restrictions to meet married lover'
item.description: Neil Ferguson, who advised Boris Johnson to introduce lockdown measures to combat coronavirus, has resigned after he breached restrictions to visit his married lover.

item.title: Government scientist: I was ousted for resisting demands to 'flood' U.S. with hydroxychloroquine
item.description: Rick Bright, former director of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority, filed a formal whistleblower complaints saying he was shifted from his role as retaliation.

item.title: Coronavirus US: De Blasio says NYC won't reopen til September
item.description: The city is on lockdown along with the rest of the state until May 15 at least, after which point is must meet seven requirements set out by Gov. Andrew Cuomo before it can reopen.

item.title: Paramedic, 22, returns to frontlines after recovering from coronavirus which left her with pneumonia
item.description: Lucy Fitton, 22, from Birmingham, said she is 'lucky to be alive' after contracting Covid-19 and then pneumonia, which left her bed-bound.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock accused of sexist remark to MP
item.description: The Health Secretary disagreed when Dr Rosena Allin-Khan said the policy had 'cost lives' in the UK and told her she should 'take a leaf out of the shadow secretary of state's book for tone'.

item.title: BBC will close the 'majority' of its smaller support offices used by regional news teams
item.description: The BBC has announced it is to close the 'majority' of its smaller news offices across England as part of an £80m cost-cutting drive, during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Secretary Dominic Raab says Premier League return under consideration
item.description: UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab has assured the public that getting sport back up and running again amid the coronavirus pandemic is 'under active consideration.'

item.title: 'Dominant' version of coronavirus causing Europe's outbreak
item.description: Researchers from the University of Sheffield and Los Alamos National Laboratory in New Mexico found that a newer, faster-spreading version of the virus seems to edge out the older type.

item.title: Rush-hour traffic creeps up with another 1% rise on roads around London
item.description: Number 10's deputy chief scientific adviser Professor Angela McLean expressed concern at the figures at Tuesday's Downing Street press conference.

item.title: Man is stabbed to death in aisle of a Co-op after woman went 'berserk'
item.description: The elderly man, who was shopping with his wife, was stabbed and died in the aisle of the Co-op in the village of Pen-y-Graig in Rhondda, South Wales. A 29-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE documents hidden by government are leaked
item.description: Some 16 documents from Special Advisory Group on Emergencies (Sage) meetings since February were released this morning, taking the total to 28. But it leaves more than 90 still secret.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Furlough cash 'could be reduced to 60% wages'
item.description: Rishi Sunak is trying to figure out a way to 'wind down' the employee support scheme which currently sees the state pay 80 per cent of a worker's wages up to a monthly cap of £2,500.

item.title: Dominic Raab condemns 'predatory' hacking attacks amid coronavirus
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab highlighted a surge in cyber attacks on the UK and US saying criminals and 'hostile states' were trying to take advantage of the crisis for their own 'malicious ends'.
item.media:description: Last month the NCSC launched its Suspicious Email Reporting Service (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: Russell Crowe was nearly mauled by a tiger during filming for Gladiator
item.description: Director Ridley Scott revealed the actor suffered a few close calls as he filmed a scene when his character Maximus Decimus Meridius faced off with the furry predator.

item.title: Magical new photographs of the wild horses on America's Cumberland Island by Anouk Krantz
item.description: The pictures, by Anouk Krantz, first appeared in book Wild Horses of Cumberland Island in 2017 - and the publisher, Images Publishing, has now released a second edition.

item.title: Does banning travellers REALLY curb coronavirus?
item.description: The UK's death toll (29,427) surpassed Italy's (29,315) today, meaning it is the worst-hit nation on the continent. But, even now, Britain's borders remain open, making it a global outlier.

item.title: Trump wrongly claims new projections of up to 134,000 deaths by August are 'with NO mitigation'
item.description: President Donald Trump mischaracterized two new reports that show an increased number of deaths from the coronavirus, a troubling sign of what may come as the country to reopen.

item.title: Lufthansa is losing $1million every HOUR and is negotiating $10billion handout
item.description: Lufthansa is close to finalising talks with the German government to negotiate a $10billion bailout after coronavirus travel bans caused a 99 per cent drop in passenger numbers.

item.title: Pizza Hut warns of fake websites set up to steal credit card details during the coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Demand for takeaway food has risen as a result of lockdown - and the hoax sites are the latest example of UK criminals trying to take advantage of the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Barclays customers rage as bank's systems CRASH in the middle of bounce-back loan applications
item.description: Applications for the loans, 100% guaranteed by the government, were opened on Monday with Barclays saying it received 200 applications in the first minute.

item.title: April 2020 was the joint-warmest April on record globally
item.description: People staying indoors because of the coronavirus lockdown missed out on the joint-warmest April on record, according to a new climate report issued by the European Union.

item.title: Burning Man is going virtual this year due to COVID-19
item.description: Organizers have canceled the annual arts event that was scheduled to be held in August in Nevada's Black Rock Desert as social distancing measures were put in place across the US.

item.title: Couple branded 'racist' after man painted his face black for a Zoom quiz tell critic to 'get a grip'
item.description: Twitter user Yasmin Amirah, from Kent, posted an exchange in which a woman called Sally told her to 'get a grip' for calling out her boyfriend for painting his face black for a family Zoom quiz.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson announces TV producer Michael Whitehall will join storytime series
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, posed up with rainbow balloons at her home in Windsor as she announced the latest installment of her Storytime with Fergie and Friends.

item.title: Traffic light system for easing lockdown mooted by experts
item.description: Behavioural experts floated a simple 'traffic light' system to classify activities as they warned people could struggle to grasp complicated new arrangements.

item.title: Brown rat takes on magpie in daylight battle before it is chased off by its sharp-beaked foe
item.description: The chase was filmed by magician Shaun Ames, 37, as he took his daily walk past Marble Arch, outside Hyde Park. It is thought the animals may have been fighting in order to protect their young.

item.title: Fans rush to speculate just how to pronounce the name of Elon Musk and Grimes' new son
item.description: Elon Musk and singer Grimes announced the birth of their first child together on Tuesday. The unusual name choice had fans guessing what it might mean and how to pronounce it.

item.title: Gun dealer appears in court charged with murder of his solicitor wife
item.description: Peter Hartshorne-Jones, 51, was arrested after police found his wife, corporate lawyer Silke, 41, in a critical condition at the couple's Grade II-listed farmhouse in Barham, Suffolk, early on Sunday.

item.title: Chester Zoo pays tribute to NHS and names new penguin chicks after hospitals and workers
item.description: The Humboldt penguin chicks have been named after Florence Nightingale, St Thomas' Hospital, NHS founder Aneurin Bevan, Arrowe Park Hospital and the Countess of Chester Hospital.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Nicola Sturgeon on separate Scotland strategy
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said her preference was for the UK to coordinate action, but stressed her 'overarching responsibility' was to do what was right for Scotland.

item.title: Head of the IMF urges countries to use debt relief on doctors and nurses and those who need it most
item.description: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva pleaded today for the 25 countries promised debt relief already, like Afghanistan and Yemen, to spend the money on those at high risk from the virus.

item.title: Simple blood test could identify people at greater risk of developing cancer
item.description: Studying anonymised patient records, UK researchers found that having abnormally small red blood cells appeared to double the risk of developing cancer within the next year.

item.title: Ex-public schoolboy, 19, dies from a drugs overdose at home
item.description: Former Winchester College pupil Maximilian Charles Saunders-Stoner, 19, was found dead at home in West Meon, Hampshire. A local shop owner said: 'I knew him very well. It is very sad.'

item.title: Good Omens writer Neil Gaiman SPLITS from wife Amanda Palmer after 9 years of marriage
item.description: Good Omens writer Neil Gaiman has split from wife Amanda Palmer after nine years of marriage.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: McDonald's to reopen 15 restaurants for delivery - and KFC queues cause traffic jam
item.description: Northerners slammed McDonald's after it revealed the 15 branches to reopen next week will all be in the south of England - and cars queuing for a KFC caused a major traffic jam in Wales.

item.title: Police Taser half-naked man as he goads them 'Go on, shoot me!'
item.description: Rakesh Parmar raged as he made terrifying threats to residents in Earl Shilton, Leicestershire as well as police officers on the scene leading to him being zapped with the 50,000-volt stun gun.

item.title: Families battling to get elderly relatives out of care homes over Covid fears
item.description: Legal firms across the UK have reporter a spike in the number of people looking to overturn safeguards which prevent them removing elderly residents from care facilities.

item.title: Some patients have antibodies that protect cells while others' immune cells stop viral replication
item.description: A new study, led by Tsinghua University. found that recovered coronavirus patients had varying antibodies such as immune cells that stop the virus from attaching to our cells.

item.title: 70 per cent of new Spanish coronavirus cases in last 24 hours were among medical staff
item.description: Of Spain's total cases of the coronavirus, 18 per cent have involved health staff (pictured). One official has said that infections among healthcare workers had been less serious due to their age.

item.title: Tumblr deletes more than 4 million re-blogs containing hate speech as part of a new policy
item.description: The move to remove re-blogged content containing hate speech marks an escalation in Tumblr's efforts to clean its platform. Previously only original posts were removed while re-blogs remained active.

item.title: Interviewee mentored by Meghan Markle landed the job
item.description: Krisi Uzunova, of London, was taking part in a video call with Smart Works to prepare for an internship interview in March when Meghan joined the call. The interview went well and she got the internship.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic will axe THIRD of its workforce
item.description: Virgin Atlantic will axe 3,000 jobs and cease operations at Gatwick Airport as it battles for survival amid the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Euromillions winner Adrian Bayford battles to save games room he built on his £10m country estate
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The multi-millionaire stripped out a garage and replaced a leaking roof to turn the outbuilding into a snooker room and cinema with a bar at his £10m estate in Linton, Cambridgeshire

item.title: Coronavirus: UK now has Europe's HIGHEST death toll
item.description: Death certificate data from the UK's Office for National Statistics suggest that more than 40,000 people have already died of COVID-19, more victims than there were in the Blitz in World War Two.

item.title: Defiant HS2 protesters clash with workers as they refuse to leave tree-top camp in ancient woodland
item.description: Demonstrators were today confronted by officers for climbing atop a lorry, while police are investigating claims that an activist was assaulted by a worker in Crackley Woods, Warwickshire.

item.title: Expert: Cities could be treated differently to rural areas when lockdown ends
item.description: Cities and rural areas could be treated differently when coronavirus lockdown measures are eased, the Government's Chief Scientific Adviser hinted today.

item.title: TikTok user reveals how to blow out candles on a birthday cake without spreading germs
item.description: The video was shared by user Utulei Rachel Manu, from Washington, who advised that you keep the plastic casing on a cake and then stick the candles to the top of it, before blowing them out.

item.title: Accounts worker, 65, is jailed for five years for stealing nearly half a million pounds from brewery
item.description: A court heard that Lesley Freestone, 65, (left) made hundreds of fake transactions by duplicating invoices and processing payments into her own accounts at the St Austell Brewery in Cornwall.

item.title: Experts warn there's NOTHING to stop people lying to NHS's coronavirus tracking app
item.description: The UK app is currently the only one in the world that will allow an element of self reporting - letting users trigger alerts to other people by reporting they have symptoms.

item.title: How George W. Bush rejected diplomacy with the Taliban to launch Afghanistan invasion after 9/11
item.description: A new documentary about George W. Bush sheds new light on the events after the September 11, 2001 attacks, which turned Bush into a wartime president.

item.title: Wolf spiders are resorting to CANNIBALISM as warming Arctic causes population to rise
item.description: Researchers working in Alaska observed wolf spiders eating juvenile spiders due to a warming Arctic that is making them grow larger and produce more offspring, resulting in less resources.

item.title: French stars set to be a hot property in the Premier League as Ligue 1 clubs look to claw back cash
item.description: After the shock revelation on Tuesday afternoon that the Ligue 1 season would not be restarting, clubs have been left to count the cost of the decision. That could leave some open to losing their top talents.

item.title: Is there more than Un? Wild theories circulate that Kim Jong Un uses a body double
item.description: North Korean state media broadcast images of Kim at a ribbon-cutting ceremony at a fertiliser plant on the outskirts of Pyongyang on Friday, his first appearance since April 11.

item.title: Heir who splashes £250,000 on motorbikes says homeless people are looking for a 'free handout'
item.description: Josh, 21, who boasts a £250,000 collection of rare motorcycles features in tomorrow's episode of Rich Kids Go Skint on Channel 5, where he spent three nights sleeping rough in London.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 12 different strains in March, one unique
item.description: Leading genetic scientists analysed the genomes of the killer virus in 260 infected patients from all corners of the UK. They say they have identified 12 unique mutations (shown).

item.title: Air France, KLM and Lufthansa make face masks compulsory for passengers amid the coronavirus crisis
item.description: Air France and KLM say they will be asking customers to wear a mask throughout their journey from next Monday. German airline Lufthansa brought in the new rule yesterday (May 4).

item.title: Collapsed private school attended by Sarah Ferguson 'demands parents pay £3,900 summer term fees'
item.description: HawleyHurst school in Blackwater, Hampshire, went into administration last month, with HMRC claiming it is owed money. But last week parents learned they were being billed for the summer term.

item.title: UK cinemas could reopen with strict social distancing as early as mid-July
item.description: Tim Richards, chief executive of the Vue Cinemas chain, said he is 'hopeful' that cinemas can be open in time for the release date of Nolan's new film, Tenet, on July 17.

item.title: The Sage Files: UK scientists believe coronavirus cases in China are TEN TIMES higher than claimed
item.description: Documents released today from the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage) show that UK scientists believed that the number of cases was vastly higher than admitted by Beijing.

item.title: How Met Gala celebs have channeled Star Wars characters over the years
item.description: The Met Gala usually falls on the first Monday in May, which this year\ happened to be May 4 - Star Wars Day. IMDb tweeted a thread of stars in their Met Gala best compared to Star Wars characters

item.title: Moment out-of-control Range Rover smashes into a lamp-post
item.description: The white Range Rover was hurled across Brighton Road in Purley, London, by the force of the impact. Police are searching for two men believed to have been involved in the crash.

item.title: Joe Exotic's legal team are planning to ask Trump to pardon convicted zookeeper
item.description: Joe Exotic's lawyers are preparing to send his case to President Trump in an attempt to get the convicted zookeeper pardoned.

item.title: Crowds of mourners ignore social distancing rules as dozens pack cemetery
item.description: People packed into Oxbridge Cemetery in Stockton, Teesside on Tuesday to pay their respects. Cleveland Police were said to be, 'keeping an eye on the situation.'

item.title: FTSE 100 opens up 1.6% or 94 points to 5848 after US stocks staged late rally
item.description: London markets rebounded this morning and opened up by 1.6 per cent after US stocks staged a late rally and European countries start to ease coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Girl, 14, has decaying 'oyster toenail' popped off 'like a bottle cap' in My Feet Are Killing Me!
item.description: Gianna, 14, from the US, visits a clinci in New Jersey to have her decaying 'oyster toenail' popped off 'like a bottle cap' in tonight's episode of Quest Red's My Feet Are Killing Me!

item.title: Even medieval plague doctors had better PPE!
item.description: Dr Jon Orrell, a senior partner at Royal Crescent Surgery in Weymouth, Dorset, shared a video of his family members dressed in various styles of PPE.

item.title: Terrifying moment the surface of a busy highway bridge shakes up and down like waves
item.description: Shocking footage from today shows the Humen Bridge, which spans across the Pearl River in southern Chinese province Guangdong, shaking dramatically while being jam-packed by cars.

item.title: Doctors say they're inundated with calls about COVID toes from people with no other symptoms
item.description: Doctors say they're being inundated with calls about COVID toes, mysterious bruises, rashes and lesions on their feet, who don't have other traditional symptoms such as fever and coughing.

item.title: Leaked report exposes London Underground chaos ahead
item.description: The report shows that if a two-metre social distancing rule is implemented, tens of thousands of commuters will be unable to board London's Tubes at peak times.

item.title: India sees its highest single-day jump in coronavirus cases with 3,900
item.description: The country of 1.3billion saw its total number of cases rise to 46,432 while the death toll is now 1,568 after another 195 fatalities, India's health ministry said (pictured, a woman buying drinks in Delhi).

item.title: UK roads could become 'dangerous postcode lotteries' during lockdown
item.description: Nick Freeman said the decision by some police forces not to pursue low-level speeding cases will mean motorists in certain parts of the country will effectively have the green light to put their foot down.

item.title: Houston we have a slime blob! Astronauts release Nickelodeons' iconic green slime on the ISS
item.description: Astronauts on the ISS received a package of Nickelodeon's iconic green slime, which they used to play ping pong and slime each other to see how the goo behaves in microgravity.

item.title: FIVE-year-old boy driving his parents' car is pulled over on the freeway
item.description: Trooper Rick Morgan noticed an SUV driving erratically and swerving between lanes on a freeway in Ogden, Utah just before noon on Monday.

item.title: Reopening schools too early risks spike in coronavirus spread
item.description: The leaders of teaching unions across the UK have warned that reopening schools prematurely 'would be catastrophic to the rate of infection' and asked that 'significant caution' be exercised by ministers.

item.title: Government experts warn reimposing lockdown would be 'serious failure'
item.description: Ministers have been warned by their expert scientific advisers that lifting the coronavirus lockdown and then reimposing restrictions later would be seen by the public as a 'serious failure'.

item.title: Adorable stray living in an abandoned house leads shoppers towards the cat food aisle
item.description: Tania Lizbeth Santos Coy Tova, 33, bonded with a cat she called Rabbit when it started following her along a street in Mexico.

item.title: Government science experts warn antibody tests could prompt workers to try to catch coronavirus
item.description: Employers could shun workers who have not had coronavirus after lockdown, prompting people to actively try to catch the disease, the government's science experts warned ministers.

item.title: Iranian airline 'fuelled Middle East's coronavirus crisis by continuing flights to China'
item.description: Mahan Air, a private company linked to the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), is accused of lying about these flights after Tehran barred all flights to China on January 31.

item.title: Calls for 'small-scale' church funerals to be restarted
item.description: A letter signed by 36 MPs suggests clergy should be allowed into Britain's churches to officiate services while adhering to safety procedures.

item.title: Italy WILL face a deadlier second coronavirus wave, grim Imperial College London study finds
item.description: British researchers modelled how the virus would spread in three scenarios - if Italy stayed in quarantine or if movement returned to pre-lockdown levels by 20% and 40% (shown in red).

item.title: Recovering from coronavirus 'almost certainly' WON'T stop people from getting it AGAIN
item.description: Sir Patrick Vallance told MPs that the vast majority of those who manage to beat the disease will get 'some degree of protection' but it will not totally rule out them becoming ill again.

item.title: Sophie Wessex opens Nightingale Hospital in Sunderland by video link
item.description: The UK's newest NHS Nightingale hospital has opened in Sunderland today, less than 24 hours after the flagship facility in the Capital was mothballed.

item.title: Is this tiny island with 100 residents on the River Thames the only coronavirus-free zone in London?
item.description: One of the capital's floating communities, Taggs Island, is tucked away from the city on a peaceful stretch of the river in Richmond upon Thames and is occupied by just over 100 residents.

item.title: How WASHING baked beans instantly turns them into trendy haricots and can save you £120 a year
item.description: Baked beans generally cost two thirds less than haricots, despite being exactly the same product just with tomato sauce added - offering an annual saving of £120 based on one can a day.

item.title: China claims 'Pompeo betrays Christianity with lies'
item.description: The Global Times, a major Communist propaganda outlet, alleged that as a 'devout Christian', Pompeo had committed the sin of lying and suggested that he should be punished.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Police force mocked for 'fashion advice'
item.description: South Yorkshire Police (SYP) issued an alert on April 30 that seemed to mock someone for having an 'essential saunter in jeans as exercise'. Pictured: Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, April 24.

item.title: Canada pet owner struggles to shift huge hound after it lies in the road and refuses to move
item.description: A dog owner in Canada struggled to motivate her dog to keep walking in a hilarious video. Neighbours laughed as the woman struggled to move her dog after it lay in the middle of the road.

item.title: Daredevil has a lucky escape when he flies into electricity cables after taking off from a car park
item.description: A paraglider in America had a lucky escape after taking off straight into electricity cables. The hobbyist from Owassa, Oklahoma, got tangled in electricity cables after taking off in a car park.

item.title: Michelle Obama changed White House dress code for butlers
item.description: Michelle Obama changed the White House dress codes for butlers because she didn't want her daughters 'thinking that grown African American men serve them in tuxedos'.

item.title: Paris will create 30 miles of cycle lanes to ease public transport pressure as it leaves lockdown
item.description: City mayor Anne Hidalgo, 60, said the Boulevard Saint-Michel and the express tunnel under the chaotic roundabout at the Arc de Triomphe were two streets that will include cycle lanes.

item.title: Sofia of Sweden and doctor leading coronavirus vaccine race are amoung Vogue's Forces for Change
item.description: Princess Sofia of Sweden, 35, and Professor Sarah Gilbert, 58, have been named as Vogue's latest Forces for Change after Meghan Markle, 38, introduced the principle in the September issue.

item.title: 'Coronavirus SAVED my life!': Asthma-sufferer, 36, learns she has fatal heart condition in hospital
item.description: Angela Schlegel from London was taken to hospital with coronavirus. She was diagnosed with the potentially fatal eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)

item.title: Mother of murdered toddler James Bulger has to cancel her son's 30th birthday
item.description: Denise Fergus, 52, from Liverpool, told FEMAIL she's been forced to postpone the Black Tie and Tiara Ball to mark what would have been her son's milestone birthday because of cronavirus.

item.title: Shocking moment boy, 12, crashes his mum's £20,000 Renault into a tree
item.description: The 12-year-old boy hit a lorry, mounted a kerb, sped over two roundabouts and went through a red light before smashing the car into two trees in Bradford, West Yorkshire.

item.title: Ministers say healthy over 70s WILL be released from lockdown with the rest of UK
item.description: The latest ONS figures show that anxiety levels have doubled during the lockdown and fuelled by the over-70s who are no longer happier than the younger generation.

item.title: O2 mobile network goes DOWN across much of the UK
item.description: O2's mobile network has been suffering from an outage that left thousands of customers across the UK unable to make or receive calls for around two hours.

item.title: 80 per cent of shag nests on a Scottish island contain plastic
item.description: Plastic debris has been found in 80 per cent of the nests of a species of seabird on an uninhabited island off the coast of Scotland.

item.title: Harry and Meghan's biography reaches the bestseller list in 24 hours
item.description: Last night the book's British co-author Omid Scobie took to Twitter to share his surprise at the much-anticipated book hitting the top spot on Amazon's 24 hour list on the first day.

item.title: Normal People fan sets up an Instagram fan page for Connell's chain as Asos sells out of lookalike
item.description: The simple silver chain - which is described in the book as 'Argos chic' and is used to emphasise the class divide between Connell and Marianne now has its own Instagram account.

item.title: Carrie Symonds thanks the midwives who delivered baby Wilfred
item.description: Carrie Symonds praised the NHS maternity team at UCLH in London, the hospital where she gave birth to her newborn son Wilfred Lawrie Nicholas Johnson, tweeting: 'You guys are incredible'.

item.title: EastEnders PICTURE EXCLUSIVE: The new Queen Vic pub is FINALLY revealed
item.description: The iconic pub had previously been shrouded in plastic sheeting and scaffolding as work on the building was underway, but the brand new pale brick exterior of the Queen Vic is now visible.

item.title: Frenchman, 43, reveals he is the 'patient zero' who had coronavirus last December
item.description: Amirouche Hammar (pictured) came forward after a hospital near Paris revealed it had re-tested old flu samples and found a positive test for coronavirus on December 27.

item.title: Police arrest two men and a woman in murder investigation in Maidstone
item.description: Jamie Simmons, 29, was said to have been attacked a number of times with a large knife at his property in Maidstone, Kent, following a fight which broke out at about 9pm last night.

item.title: Royal expert tells Ok! how Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's son Archie will spend his first birthday
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 38, are set to celebrate their son Archie's first birthday tomorrow at their home in Los Angeles, with Katie Nicholl telling Okay! about their plans for the day.

item.title: Russia sees coronavirus cases rise by 10,000 for a third day running
item.description: The latest rise of 10,102 cases, bringing the total from 145,268 to 155,370, confirms Russia's place as Europe's new virus hotbed as infections slow elsewhere.

item.title: How Winston Churchill's birthplace Blenheim Palace became top secret testing ground
item.description: The images show prototype amphibious landing craft vehicles being put through their paces on the lake at Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire.

item.title: Woman convicted for biting off alleged rapist's tongue in South Korea when she was 18 seeks retrial
item.description: Choi Mal-ja, 74, was sentenced to six months in prison in 1964 for biting off half an inch of her alleged attacker's tongue not far from her home in Busan.

item.title: China launches spacecraft via largest carrier rocket
item.description: The Long March-5B carrier rocket took off at 6pm local time at the Wenchang Space Launch Center in the southern island province of Hainan, state broadcaster CCTV announced on Tuesday.

item.title: 'Absolute searing pain!' Wildlife show presenter screams in agony as he is stung by 'murder' hornet
item.description: Extreme wildlife show host Nathaniel 'Coyote' Peterson, 38, clutched his arm in pain after he was stung by the world's largest hornet in Japan. They have recently arrived in the US.

item.title: Inmate, 18, jailed for a group attack on a young girl admits he self-harms to 'show remorse'
item.description: In BBC Three's Boys Banged Up, filmed at Hydebank Wood prison in Northern Ireland, inmate William claims he self harms out of remorse for his part in an attack on a young girl.

item.title: 'Incredulous' Nigel Farage visited by police
item.description: The law enforcers 'advised' Mr Farage on lockdown rules and essential travel after a complaint was reportedly made following his trip to the Port of Dover in Kent.

item.title: AI-powered traffic lights to keep drivers waiting on red to cut air pollution
item.description: Wolverhampton is the first in the country to approve a trial of an AI-powered system that will manipulate red and green lights to restrict function to air pollution hotspots.

item.title: Campaigners slam Olly Murs TikToks, saying they encourage 'abuse dressed up as banter'
item.description: In a recent tiktok video, the pop star, 35, is seen acting out a comedy scene that uses violent language from the 2008 film Step Brothers with girlfriend Amelia Tank, 27.

item.title: Pfizer doses first 'young and healthy' Americans with experimental coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Pfizer has developed four different candidate vaccines for coronavirus and announced Tuesday that its begun testing them in human subjects in the US in the hopes a shot will be ready before 2021.

item.title: Iceland claims success against coronavirus with only 1,799 cases and 10 deaths
item.description: Iceland has reduced its daily infection count from 106 at the height of the crisis to single digits and even zero on some days.

item.title: Deborah James, who has stage four bowel cancer, reveals she's had to have a new tumour zapped
item.description: Deborah James, from South London, was told she was free of the disease earlier this year. However, her tumour markers, which indicate a new growth, have spiked in recent weeks.

item.title: Wearing masks can curb spread of coronavirus, Government's chief scientist says
item.description: Sir Patrick Vallance told MPs on the Health and Social Care Select Committee that masks could have a 'marginal but positive' impact on curbing transmission of the life-threatening infection.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sweden 'probably had cases in November'
item.description: Sweden's state epidemiologist Anders Tegnell claimed individual cases of coronavirus would have been detected among travellers from Wuhan.

item.title: Tiny shepherdess, three, tells This Morning how much she 'loves' her sheep Ethel
item.description: Barley, three, from Norfolk, who became an internet sensation after her sheep handling video went viral, has won over the hearts of the nation all over again after appearing on This Morning.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SEWAGE analysis may be used to track spread
item.description: Defra confirmed it is conferring with scientists about whether wastewater can help trace the spread of the deadly infection. It could become part of the government's plan to ease Britain out of lockdown.

item.title: Horrifying moment thugs throw puppy against brick wall before dunking it in paddling pool
item.description: WARNING - GRAPHIC CONTENT: A defenceless puppy was repeatedly flung into the air while yobs laughed and filmed the abuse with phones in the back garden of a house in west Dublin, Ireland.

item.title: How becoming a father later in life is cool
item.description: These British 50-somethings are all proof that being a 'LILF', or 'later-in-life father, is the 'new cool', according to Tatler.

item.title: Mugshots taken 10 years apart show ravages of heroin on addict as she is jailed for burgling
item.description: Sarah Ali, who became hooked on heroin at the age of just 12, is beginning her latest prison sentence for house burglary after the trademark invasion of an elderly couple's home in Thornaby, Teesside.

item.title: Moment reckless driver almost hits a five-year-old girl before her stepfather jumps in front of car
item.description: Dash-cam footage shows a driver almost crashing into Jason Payne, 34, and his five-year-old stepdaughter, Gracie, as the family use a zebra crossing on Green Lane in Birmingham yesterday.

item.title: Jailed Saudi princess fears coronavirus risk in prison
item.description: Princess Basmah bint Saud, a 56-year-old businesswoman and outspoken royal family member is being held without charge in Riyadh's high-security Al-Ha'ir prison.

item.title: 17th Century mansion that once belonged to Gucci heir Paolo goes on sale for £2.75million
item.description: The extravagant country pile in the village of Rusper, close to the border of Surrey and West Sussex, also boasts a music room, a games room, six bath and shower rooms and a roof terrace.

item.title: Wizz Air announces launch of SIX more routes serving Luton Airport including flights to Faro
item.description: Wizz Air has announced the launch of six new routes serving Luton Airport from next month.These include flights to Faro in Portugal.

item.title: Sheltered housing staff pin up posters of COFFINS to encourage elderly residents to self-isolate
item.description: Elderly people living at William Lench Court in Birmingham were horrified by the stark signs, which also threatened that no one would look after them if staff got sick.

item.title: EU says Britain is not seeing downward trend in coronavirus cases
item.description: EU disease control chief Andrea Ammon said the UK was one of five European countries along with Poland, Romania, Sweden and Bulgaria which have yet to see a downward trend in cases.

item.title: Normal People drives BBC Three to its best-ever week on iPlayer
item.description: Dubbed 'the first great millennial love story', the 12-part BBC series Normal People stars Cold Feet actress Daisy Edgar-Jones as Marianne and Paul Mescal in his first television role as Connell.

item.title: Household energy usage surges by 37% during lockdown
item.description: The average annual cost of a combined gas and electricity bill is around £1,034, but due to increased usage whilst people are stuck inside, this could rise to £1,421.

item.title: Hampton Court manor house is for sale for £6.5m
item.description: Prestbury House is located off Hampton Court Road in London, and boasts eight large bedrooms, substantial gardens and plenty of grand living spaces as well as modern interior.

item.title: Former cricketer Shane Warne reveals he's set to star in his own documentary
item.description: Shane Warne has revealed he'll be at the centre of an upcoming documentary for Amazon Prime. He made the announcement via a text message to friend Eddie McGuire.

item.title: Dramatic moment RAF Typhoon jets destroy ISIS base hidden in six caves
item.description: Two Typhoon jets, flying out of RAF Akrotiri in Cyprus, used Paveway IV guided bombs to hit the cave entrances near Bayji in northern Iraq during the night-time strike on April 28.

item.title: Eta Aquariids meteor shower peaks TONIGHT filling the sky with up to 40 shooting stars an hour
item.description: This meteor shower is best viewed in the southern hemisphere, but should be visible from most places on Earth, weather permitting.

item.title: Tunguska event was caused by an asteroid that bounced back to space
item.description: Russian scientists suggest the mysterious 'Tunguska event' explosion of 1908 was caused by an iron asteroid that entered the Earth's atmosphere and then bounced back into space.

item.title: Insects are gorging themselves on 'junk' as rising CO2 levels make plants less nutritious
item.description: Experts studying a grassland preserve in Kansas discovered that its grasshopper numbers have fallen by more than 30 per cent over the last two decades.

item.title: How to make itsu meatball at home
item.description: Asian-inspired food chain, itsu has revealed the recipe for its delicious meatballs, and has even teamed up with plant-based company, Meatless Farm to reveal how to make the vegan version.

item.title: Putin awards war medal to Kim marking victory over Nazi Germany
item.description: Russia's ambassador in North Korea, Alexander Matsegora, presented the award to foreign minister Ri Son-gwon on Tuesday at the Mansudae Palace of Congress in Pyongyang.

item.title: Retired couple's award-winning 'Four Seasons' garden explodes with spring joy
item.description: A retired couple from Walsall in the West Midlands have transformed a garden featuring little more than a muddy lawn into an award winning all-year round masterpiece.

item.title: Duck, duck, CAR! Terrifying moment driver runs over mother bird and her ducklings
item.description: The mother and her eleven ducklings were crossing a six-lane highway when the vehicle ran over them in Fort Worth, Texas. Drivers can be charged with animal cruelty for hitting ducks.

item.title: Mugger faces jail after his attempt to rob retired bus driver, 77, at cashpoint ended in failure
item.description: Michael Collins, 40, tried to rob 77-year-old retired bus driver Trevor Weston at a supermarket cash machine in Cardiff. But the flat-capped shopper put up his fists to say: 'Do you want some of this pal?'

item.title: Terrifying moment Nissan Note drives the wrong way down 'road of death' near Cambridge
item.description: A motorist was caught on camera driving on the wrong side of the A1307 near Cambridge towards oncoming traffic. The blue Nissan Note'd driver then performed a three-point turn in the road.

item.title: Aer Lingus says coronavirus safety a `top priority´...
item.description: The airline is to conduct a review of its Belfast to London Heathrow service after acknowledging `unexpectedly high loads´ on a Monday morning flight.

item.title: Priest runs social distancing 'car park confessions' in Ireland amid the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: An unnamed priest was seen leaning forward to listen intently while a woman in a pink coat sat opposite him, confessing her sins outside St Mark's Church in Tallaght, South Dublin.

item.title: Sabotage or a technical fault? British Airways 777 and 787 are covered in five tons of foam
item.description: The Boeing 777 and 787 will be out of action for months after the incident at London's Heathrow on Sunday, which has led to claims of 'sabotage'. But British Airways have said it is due to a technical fault.

item.title: Princess Anne shares message of support with nurses on International Day of the Midwife
item.description: In a video shared to the Royal Family's Instagram account, Princess Anne, 69, paid tribute to healthcare professionals across the UK as they celebrate International Day of the Midwife.

item.title: Hostage rescued from Iranian embassy siege thanks SAS hero
item.description: Sim Harris, 64, had been waiting for a visa at the embassy in South Kensington, West London, when six armed men stormed the site and took him and 25 others hostage.

item.title: Couple brought together when sailor passed pen pal request over
item.description: Jack and Shirley Godley, from Sheffield, South Yorkshire, were brought together in 1957 when she answered a pen pal advertisement in the paper by a seaman looking for friendship.

item.title: Met Police arrests 45 suspected online paedophiles in first four weeks of lockdown
item.description: Officers from the Metropolitan Police online child abuse and exploitation unit arrested dozens of suspects and safeguarded 92 children in the first four weeks of lockdown.

item.title: Susanna Reid tells of her 'big relief' to learn GMB co-host Piers Morgan had tested negative
item.description: Good Morning Britain host Susanna Reid said the negative result was a 'big relief', and Dr Hilary Jones added: 'We wish him a quick and swift recovery.'

item.title: Around the world emoji quiz challenges you to name 26 countries
item.description: Nikki Spiers, 31, from London, became an internet hit in March after a WhatsApp emoji quiz she sent to her friends was shared around the world, and now she's back with a geography special.

item.title: Deliberately infecting healthy Britons may be the only way to test a COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: Lockdown will make it difficult to assess the successful of a vaccine - such as that developed by University of Oxford - because it is preventing the spread of the virus globally.

item.title: Moment a giant 5,000-tonne crane folds in half and collapses as it lifts a barge during load tests
item.description: The crane, designed to lift nine A380 planes, collapsed during stress tests in Rostock, Germany. It had been destined for Moray East wind farm, which could be delayed by the collapse.

item.title: Parents reveal their children eat electrical wiring, stones and even their own SKIN
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Three families from the UK have spoken to FEMAIL to reveal how they cope with the daily battle of keeping their children with pica safe - including youngsters who eat stone and wires.

item.title: Council flat tenant reveals how she transformed her sitting room simply by swapping the carpet
item.description: Laura Stockdale, from Sussex, who shares two daughters with her fiance Morgan, took to Facebook group DIY on a Budget , to reveal how she simply swapped their old and tired carpet for a vinyl floor.

item.title: Frying pan pizza becomes the latest lockdown foodie trend to take over Instagram
item.description: British supermarket Waitrose has shared its simple recipe for making pizza in the frying pan as home chefs across the UK share their attempts on social media.

item.title: Frying pan pizza becomes the latest lockdown foodie trend to take over Instagram
item.description: British supermarket Waitrose has shared its simple recipe for making pizza in the frying pan as home chefs across the UK share their attempts on social media.

item.title: Woman slams her mother-in-law for posting photos of her baby son on Facebook without asking
item.description: A UK woman sparked a debate over sharing photos of children online. Writing on Mumsnet, she vented her fury that her mother-in-law posted a photo of her baby on Facebook without asking.

item.title: Italian Barilla chef Andrea Tranchero shares pasta mistakes and the perfect sauce for each shape
item.description: Australian-Italian chef Andrea Tranchero has shared the most common mistakes home cooks make when preparing pasta, and the perfect wine pairing with every dish.

item.title: How do online orthodontics work? We investigate
item.description: A spate of new companies offering at home orthodontic and so-called 'teledentistry' treatments have sprung up over the past 18 months or so. But how can you effectively fit braces at home?

item.title: Home cook shares her three-step recipe for beef and red wine casserole
item.description: An amateur cook has shared her three-step recipe for beef and red wine casserole, and it's so simple you can put it together in just 25 minutes.

item.title: Billions of people could experience 'nearly unlivable conditions' by 2070 due to climate change
item.description: A new study warns that nearly 3.5 billion people around the world could face 'nearly unlivable' conditions by 2070 due to climate change, as temperatures could rise nearly 59 degrees.
